title: (x) What typography is this? / 'loraier': monolinear script - probably hand-drawn, alternatives {Andreas, Lex}
content:
Hello everyone!  
I'm trying to identify this type but there is no way ... I've tried WhatTheFont but not recognized as individual letters.  
Someone could help me? It is very possible that there is no exact font, but one that might appear as it would help.  
Thank you very much!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081021im_/http:/typophile.com/files/loraier_5945.jpg)
author: parenta

comments.content: The r's are different. In all probability this is not a font.

Yes, I know Fontgrube ... So I'm looking for a typeface that look like this as much as possible.  
Tanks for your answer! And sorry for my english... Maybe not express myself too well.

The one that jumped to mind for me was [School Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081021/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/school_script_virtual/) which is in the [Casual Monolinear Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081021/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/casual_monolinear_script/) genre.

- Lex

It also resembles [Angel Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081021/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/angel-script/) from Positype.

[edit: ooops! I see it was in the list linked above.]

- Mike Yanega
